quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Saturn and Spacecraft
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, pioneer, mirror. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Saturn is visible without any optical aid.
Pioneer 11 was the first spacecraft to study Saturn in this year.
The atmosphere of Saturn consists mainly of what element?
How long does it take Saturn to complete one orbit around the Sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: just under 30 years

questions.question: Saturn has more then 80 known moons.
Saturns largest moon is known by what name?
Did Isaac Newton formulate the famous equation E=mc²?
What is the name of the major gap in the ring system around Saturn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cassini Division

questions.question: What does a convex mirror do?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It deceases the size

questions.question: Saturn is the Roman name of the Greek Titan Cronus. Who is Cronus son?
Is it possible to see around corners?
What is the name of the spacecraft that entered Saturns orbit in 2004?
Light slows down in this object and causes it to look bent.
Light waves travel in a straight line.
What does a concave mirror do with the object that is reflected?

options.text: It widens the size of the object.
It increases the size of the object.
It decreases the size of the object.
Depends on the on the distance between the object and the mirror.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Depends on the on the distance between the object and the mirror.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Neptune and Atom
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, nucleus, part. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many moons does Neptune have?
Which of the following determines to which chemical element a certain atom belongs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The number of protons

questions.question: The planet Neptune can be seen with the naked eye.
Which two elements comprise the bulk of the atmosphere of Neptune?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hydrogen and Helium

questions.question: What was the name of the first spacecraft that visited Neptune?
Which is the only stable chemical element whose atom can contain no neutrons at all in its nucleus?
What part of the atoms mass is concentrated in its nucleus?
On what date was the planet Neptune discovered?
How long is one day on the planet Neptune?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Just over 16 hours

questions.question: How long does it take Neptune to orbit the Sun once?
What is the name of the 1997 sci-fi horror movie, starring Sam Neil, that takes place in orbit around the planet Neptune?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Event Horizon

questions.question: What does the number of neutrons in the nucleus of an atom determine?

options.text: The charge of the ions of the element

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The isotope of the element

questions.question: If an atom loses an electron its electromagnetic balance is disturbed and the atom decays releasing  ionizing particles and a large amount of energy.
The word atom comes from the Greek atomos which means what?
Neptune has rings around it just like Saturn.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Kind and Statements
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, parasite, diseases. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these does a positive hydrogen ion lack?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Electrons and neutrons

questions.question: What kind of animal is the primary host of the protozoan Toxoplasma gondii which causes toxoplasmosis?
What does the atomic number of the atom define?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its number of protons

questions.question: What is the name of the device used to measure the mass of atoms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mass spectrometer

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about ticks, common ectoparasites and vectors of numerous diseases?

options.text: Young ticks have 6 legs, and mature ticks have 8 legs.
They live on mammals, birds, reptiles and amphibians.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What kind of organisms cause the parasitic infection known as ringworm?

Although it was thought to be the smallest component of matter, physicists discovered that the atom consists of electrons, protons and neutrons. But even some of these subatomic particles can be broken down further.
Which of these diseases is caused by the African tsetse fly?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This food is rich in omega – 3 fatty acids, magnesium and potassium.
What kind of animal causes the parasitic Dracunculiasis disease that is endemic to Sub-Saharan Africa?

options.text: An insect that injects a plasmodium through its bite
A mite that is carried by poultry
A lizard that carries dangerous unicellular parasites
A worm whose eggs are ingested when drinking contaminated water

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A worm whose eggs are ingested when drinking contaminated water

questions.question: Which of these statements is not true about the head louse, which is an ectoparasite in humans?

options.text: It has two antennae on its head.
It has eight powerful legs specialized for jumping.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It has eight powerful legs specialized for jumping.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about parasites in general?

options.text: They are usually much smaller that their host.
They reproduce faster than their host and in much larger quantities.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the flea, a well-known external parasite?

options.text: They live on mammals and birds.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the exact meaning of the term epiparasite?

options.text: A specific type of parasite that lives in the human skin
A parasite that is actually beneficial for its host
An external parasite that lives on the outside of its hosts body
A parasite whose host is another parasite

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A parasite whose host is another parasite

questions.question: What kind of symptoms do parasite infections usually induce in humans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Microscope and Specimen
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, salmon, amount. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is the microscope part in which the lens is located.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ocular or eyepiece

questions.question: Salmon is high in which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What part of the microscope holds the draw tube in place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Body tube

questions.question: The fine adjustment knob of the microscope is used to move the body tube when focusing the specimen under the low power objective.
Berries are good for the heart.
Dark chocolate reduces blood pressure while enhancing circulation.
This microscope part supports the glass slide and the specimen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stage clip

questions.question: Lentils and beans are rich in fiber, omega-3 acids and calcium.
Almonds possess cholesterol-lowering properties.
What do avocados contain?

options.text: Vitamins B, vitamin K, vitamin E and vitamin C

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Olive oil lowers total cholesterol and LDL levels in the blood.
Spinach is extremely rich in antioxidants.
This part allows the tilting of the microscope at various angles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inclination joint

questions.question: The diaphragm regulates the amount of light reaching the microscope objective.
In 650BC the father of medicine, Hippocrates, recommended it to relieve stomach pain.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Light and Body
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, radiation, brain. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of anatomical structures does the Circle of Willis consist of?
The so-called McBurneys point is located in this part of the human body.
Which of the following is not a property of light?
In which part of the human body is the so-called Pouch of Douglas located?
According to the properties it exhibits, light is defined as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both wave and particles

questions.question: The absence of the protein called Christmas factor, a.k.a. factor IX, from the human body results in this serious disease.
Albert Einstein asserted that the energy of a photon is proportional to what in his study of the photoelectronic effects?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its frequency

questions.question: What was the occupation of the person after whom the human sideburns were named?
The common name of the tendo calcaneus or calcaneal tendon of the human body was derived from the name of this Greek mythological hero.
Where in the human body is the Golgi organ located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In tendons

questions.question: Approximately what is the speed of light in vacuum?
In which ody part of the human body can the Darwins tubercle be found in some individuals?
Brocas area is located in the human brain. What is it responsible for?
In what part of the human body are the cords of Billroth located?
We call visible light the electromagnetic radiation belonging to the what wave range?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Light and Venus
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, jupiter, mercury. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What are Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars mostly made of?
Marine 1, launched in 1961, was the first probe to visit another planet.
What is the temperature of the core of the sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 15,000,000 degrees Celsius

questions.question: Which of these thermal emissions of light is the rarest in nature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue thermal emission

questions.question: Jupiter has the largest planetary atmosphere in the Solar System.
Light, just as wind, has the ability to push objects in its path.
Venus is classified as Earths sister planet.
Is Venus the coldest planet in the Solar System?
How many major planets are there in the Solar System?
We watch TV thanks to which of these processes forming light?
In his Theory of Relativity, Albert Einstein discloses that when you multiply the speed of light by the mass you get what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The energy

questions.question: What was the second planet from the Sun called by the Greeks?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Jupiter has rings.
What property of light might change its value when a beam of light crosses the border between vacuum and another medium or between two different media?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The wavelength

questions.question: Venus was mistaken for a UFO.
